text: THEY SAY NOTHING STAYS THE SAME
Watch it! You're in my way.
Don't go back. I'm in a hurry!
I'm sorry, but it's the rule.
What rule? There are no rules for boatmen.
Sorry to stall you.  Go, boatman!
What an arrogant man he is!
I don't know him. Maybe he's from upstream?
All that banging is so noisy.
I got potatoes upstream. Want some?
Don't worry. Go home and eat.
It's always better to eat with someone.
That means I won't owe you anymore.
Hot potatoes on a hot day is hellish!
Are you okay, Toichi? Doesn't the noise bother you?
I guess I got used to it.
When the noise is unbearable, I think I'll destroy that bridge!
That bridge will be bad for you, tool
The villagers say it'll be convenient,
but they're wrong. I don't think it'll be good.
You've ferried people over the river for years.
That's how we've always got upstream.
I know the bridge will be convenient...
but then we won't need your boat, Toichi.
Let's destroy the bridge before it's done.
I can't tell if you're fooling.
...so I thought it was a boar!
I was shocked when he jumped out of the bush!
He'd be dead if I wasn't.
so he was in a daze for a while.
Thank God, he was quicker than a boar!
Damn, that noise! The fish got spooked.
I'm going to eat you up!
It'd be easier if there was a bridge.
We'll go where the water's shallow.
Are you okay?  Yes, it was no trouble.
I thought I was stuck, but you made it possible.
It'll dry on our way upstream
in this heat! And its hide is silkier.
I came from another village upstream.
Well, I guess you had your reasons for leaving...
Right. I knew that was the case.
Don't you want to go back?
I have no family or relatives there.
Do you know the Chinese character for loneliness?
The character for loneliness is similar to fox.
There are foxes around here, right?
Foxes, raccoon dogs and even bears.
foxes always seem lonely to me.
You're right. I guess foxes are lonely, too.
Mr. Boatman, I was sold as a child so my family could eat.
I worked for a medicine maker.
They had many books, so I learned to read.
I sold medicine, but I never needed any!
I did okay for a child who was sold off.
I've become sentimental about the old village.
I thought I'd never go back but
I keep thinking about the past lately.
So I went back to the village...
but there's nothing for me there anymore.
What? A kid was drifting in the river?
The boat hit something and it was a human.
I thought she was dead, but she was breathing.
Is there any around your place?
She looks better. Her breathing's steadier.
But I worry that she hit her head.
You're right. She was bleeding around here.
We don't know how far she floated.
If she got a bad blow to the head, mugwort won't help.
You're vain, that's what you are.
Lay off! I got laid. That's all that matters.
You splashed me! Don't rock the boat.
I heard that you squeal like a wild beast and die.
You make sounds?  It's more like air releasing.
It was some kind of grudge.
Right. He even killed the children?
Did you hear about it, Boatman?
No. Only what I heard you say now.
There's a village called Ichinomiya, 20 kilometers upstream.
No one told you about it?
Apparently a whole family was massacred.
Yes, they were slit, it was savage.
I heard that a boy or girl... is missing.
The killer might have taken one of them.
However it went, it's cruel. Everyone's talking about it.
She's awake but she won't say a thing!
A while ago. While you were taking someone across.
I think there was a "Whoa" or "Ugh"|
I was so surprised I said, "Ugh"!
I'm not talking about you, Genzo.
She sprang up and looked around...
Okay. I'll go see how she is.
you can rest here until you feel better.
Remember what I told you about the Ichinomiya massacre?
It wasn't the son who was kidnapped. It was the daughter.
You must ferry across many people every day.
You might have taken the killer!
Watch for anyone with a girl.
I mix mugwort with bear bile.
Why were you floating in the river?
Did you come in a giant peach?
She won't even tell me her name.
Is that girl on the rock related to you?
I have to look after her for a while.
Toichi, why did you lie to them?
I couldn't say I found her in the river.
lying isn't the way to go.
What will you gain from taking care of her?
the villagers will start getting suspicious.
You were on the other side of the river.
No, I don't live around here.
I know a lot about you.
I know a lot about you.
I woke up and she was gone.
Toichi, I'll be off early today. I'll see you soon.
Am I in the right spot?
I need to go across to the village.
I was told I could cross here.
Yes, sir. In the center, please.
I thought I'd have to row myself.
You row the boat every day?
It must be tough in this heat.
There's nothing else I can do.
Rowing boats is all I'm capable of.
You can make a living?  Sort of.
Yes, sir. I don't charge the villagers though.
I charge city folk five rin.
Pay me when we get there.
There used to be a lot of passengers.
See the rock over there? I heard there was
Oh, I could've crossed the bridge!
The bridge hasn't been completed yet.
Right. They're still working on it.
Once it's done, it'll make things easier.
I guess the area will get busier.
If it's there, I guess folks will use it.
What's important is that folks can commute with no trouble.
So I wouldn't worry about myself.
As they say, nothing stays the same.
Thank you. Oh, I have to pay.
It was nice. Will you be here later?
If you can't find me, check the hut.
The river is nice. I'll see you when I return.
It's her ass... She's an ugly bitch but what an ass.
You row a stupid boat all day.
An ugly old man like you has no chancel!
And it costs money to get laid.
Girls wouldn't do you. You're too spooky.
I wouldn't if I was a girl.
I wouldn't do you if you were a girl!
We put our blood, sweat and tears into that bridge.
The villagers are very grateful, sirs.
They can't wait for it to be finished.
I'm asking about you. Not the villagers.
Will you be happy when it's made?
Yes. I'm looking forward to it.
Then we'll make it sooner for you.
The villagers will be glad not to use this dirty boat any more.
Once it's done, it'll make things easier.
Once it's done, it'll make things easier.
But then you'll lose your job.
But then you'll lose your job.
We'll make it sooner for you.
We'll make it sooner for you.
That bridge will be bad for you!
That bridge will be bad for you!
Let's destroy the bridge before it's done.
Let's destroy the bridge before it's done.
Let's destroy the bridge before it's done.
Let's destroy the bridge before it's done.
Let's destroy the bridge before it's done.
Let's destroy the bridge before it's done.
You look dazed, boatman. Are you all right?
You said that the village was quite pretty.
I said that before I got on the boat.
You asked me why I went to the village.
I told you that I was going to see my patients.
Oh boy, you don't look like you do.
Yes, Nihei gave me potatoes the other day.
Nihei's father and I go back.
His legs are getting weak and he has a bad cold.
So I went over to see him.
But then there were more patients.
I ended up seeing a dozen patients!
If a town doctor has an easy life
he's no longer a town doctor...
Whatever I say, you only halflisten to.
That doctor's got a screw loose.
How can he forget something so important?
I think he's a great man.
He comes all the way from town to see his patients.
We sure owe him a lot,
but it's not good to forget this!
The doctor left in the late afternoon.
We only noticed his bag late at night.
but he put it by a pot in the dark doorway.
I wonder how he'll work today.
It'd be strange if he saw patients without this.
That man's going to deliver a bag to the doctor!
The doctor did his rounds here yesterday.
He left his bag at that man's place.
He's a bit of an odd character,
The doctor said he'd come back.
You should talk to him if you're still in pain.
You should consult him if you need to.
My job is to help people cross the river.
Every day, I meet all sorts of people crossing the river.
It makes me happy to help out folks a little.
I guess it means nothing to you.
I thought you went back home or something.
Do you have anywhere to go?
Well, I have little to offer, but you can stay...
I live alone so you won't be putting me out.
Ah well... I brought some bean paste that someone gave me.
I'll cook it on a hot rock.
I thought I could give you some.
Oh, I'd love that! Are you sure?
No problem. It'll last longer cooked.
I have some millet to eat.
Why don't you eat with us, Genzo?
I never say no to kindness.
I'll take care of the paste!
Yes. Genzo dropped by, so we'll eat together.
You want to join us, Nihei?
My folks are waiting to know if I returned the bag.
Was he able to work without the bag?
He was like, "Oh, I had no ideal"
But his maid told me that
he looked all over for the bag.
He even sent his patients away.
Right. It sounds like you saved him.
What would he have done if I hadn't returned it?
He said, "The boatman is quiet, but very humane."
Well I have no idea what he means.
He offered to help you if you ever need it.
How about the rumor about the incident upstream?
I just overheard it but some folk
They say cooked bean paste won't last three months.
She's been back for a while.
I haven't seen your dad around. How is he?
He's in bed with a summer cold.
Watch out. Summer colds can take a turn for the worse.
Toichi invited me to join you, but I can't today.
Don't overcook it. It'll stick to the rock.
Get the paste off before it burns.
Get the paste off before it burns.
No worries, Toichi. Most of it's yours.
So I think that's where your home is.
It's okay. As long as you have some memories.
A hit to the head can make you forget who you are.
What weird clothes! She must be a monster.
Do you think you've been in a boat before?
The river is calm here so the fish come out.
That's what it is. It's Fu.
You mean, she's not that girl?
No one's even heard that story you told me.
Thank you for visiting Ichinomiya for me.
If your name is Fu, it might mean wind.
No reason, but it might be what your name means.
I thought it'd be interesting if your name meant wind.
The wind can make the river flow faster.
It even changes the river's character.
If I'm a boatman and you're the wind
Thank you. Can you stack them there?
They have more people working on it.
I hope we can use it by autumn.
Particularly with a baby, it'll make things easier.
Boatman, can we cross the river?
Certainly. I'll get the boat ready.
I hope it goes well.  Yes.
You practiced?  Yes but it's not easy.
I want sugar candy.  Toffee for me!
Forget food! This is your first festival performance.
I know but candy's better than flowers.
You talk about food, men and...
How about focusing on your performance?
When I first started I was told
three days to use oars and three years for the pole.
Back when I started rowing boats
I saw lots of fireflies at night.
fireflies only thrive in pristine water.
And boy, those fireflies were beautiful!
there seem to be less fireflies.
Since they started building the bridge...
But when something new comes along...
the old things go. That's how it is.
Like a wind can send a boat out of control,
a breeze eventually changes the way of the world.
I guess no passengers will come in this rain.
That person is no longer around.
That person is no longer around.
The last time she crossed the river...
She said she'd never come back here so
she wanted me to keep it.
It's a secret that she shared with me.
Her face is stuck in my mind.
I don't know why she gave me that picture but...
a slight resemblance to the woman in the picture.
Why are you here in this rain?
It doesn't have to be this minute.
But please take me when you're ready.
Sorry to ask when it's raining like this.
He always hunted rabbits, deer, and boars across the river.
He always hunted rabbits, deer, and boars across the river.
He shared the game, if he did well.
"I've been living this long thanks lo the lives I took.
"When I die, give my body to the animals in the hills.
"Without my soul, I'd just be flesh.
"I'd be happy if you fed me to the animals.
I want to return their favor.”
But some folks might find it spooky to leave a body
I want to do it secretly So no one knows.
I want to fulfill his wish.
I It's a lot to ask...
Sorry I got you involved in this.
With your boat you helped him carry the lives he was given.
With your boat you helped him carry the lives he was given.
Maybe one is Nihei's dad's soul departing.
Maybe one is Nihei's dad's soul departing.
Nihei's dad was a great man.
He dedicated his life to helping others.
I'm helping others. I like to think I'm doing that but...
I hope the bridge never gets made.
I can't help thinking like that.
he wants to be of benefit.
I can't wait for the festival.
We heard that the bridge isn't finished yet...
We heard that the bridge isn't finished yet...
Thank the Lord for the boatman!
Every year I'm in the festival but...
They sure are.  I can't wait!
It's all about convenience.  We need a bridge.
It'll be great once we can walk across.
Next year we can do that.
We won't need the boat any more.  It'll be easier.
We can cart things over.  It'll be so easy.
...but I know a lot about you.
I'm a ghost and I live here.
You don't have to believe me,
but I know a lot about you.
That's why I came lo you.
That girl has the life owed to me.
She was meant to die that night...
and I was lo replace her
while her soul waited to reincarnate.
I know you well. 1 advise you to think well.
Old Toichi is kind of losing it.
Maybe you're a burden to him now.
Surely you don't want to stay here forever?
It's time you left. It'd be good for both of you.
I never told you, but I went to your village.
What I heard didn't really add up.
I can take care of you.
You look pale. I bet you're not eating well.
You need to take it easy.
It's bad to think too much.
You'd lose your mind if you did.
Life is short. Might as well enjoy it.
We need to live many lives...
We're brought to this world to learn
What you learn varies from one person to another.
You live to find that thing.
And you cross a river to move on to the next life.
I know! Since you're a boatman...
you'll have no problem crossing the Styx.
Toichi, I haven't seen you for a long time.
After this was built, I hardly visit you.
Since we got the bridge everyone acts so busy.
Many villagers went to live in town.
I miss the times you took us across.
Back when we weren't in a hurry like we are now.
can you take me out on your boat someday?
It won't get worse than this.
I won't blame you for anything!
I'm not so righteous as to blame you!
I've got nothing left here anyway.
